messages.message:
Brian
Yeah, totally!  Come on by, look at the group Battlestar Fridays at the Deathstar

np its good to hear from you
how's life going?

Brian
Awesome.  Job hunting.  I've been connecting with old friends on Facebook and asking them to compliment someone we both knew in the past.  It's been funny.
How are you?
Good good, living the tropical life out here in Guam

Brian
Guam, that's awesome.  Please tell me more.  Iga and I are looking for somewhere to vacate to.  How long have you lived there?  What is it like?

I've been here about 6 months
Its like Hawaii, with less crowds and better water

Brian
Do you have to work?

but also double the humidity and stays mid-80s to low 90s most of the time
I'm still working for AdColony that I've worked for for about 3.5 years before I moved out here
just shifted my schedule a bit
This is the view out my window right now

Brian
I love the color green.
That's awesome!
Is AdColony mostly work remote then?
What language to they speak?

Even when I lived in Washington I worked remotely because I live too far from the office to commute.
Guam is a US territory so they speak English and use the dollar
There is a native language but it's not widely used for business or from outsiders
